text: Lounis Lanseur (born 16 January 1989) is an Algerian former professional footballer who played as a defender. ==Club career== Born in Saint-Étienne, France, Lanseur began his career at age 9 with his hometown club of AS Saint- Étienne.La fiche complète de l'ancien Vert Lounis LANSEUR He worked his way up the ranks of the club and became the captain of the reserve team in the 2009–10 season. In the summer of 2010, when he was not offered a professional contract by the club, he left to join FC Libourne-Saint-Seurin. In January 2011, Lanseur was linked with a move to ES Sétif.Transferts : Zaâboub et Lanseur vers Sétif However, a month later, he ended up signing with another Algerian club, USM Blida.L1: 3 franco-algériens à l'USM Blida ==International career== On 9 August 2009, Lanseur was called up by head coach Abdelhak Benchikha to the Algerian Under-23 National Team for a week long training camp in Blida.E.N Espoir : L'EN en regroupement à Blida He was called up again later that month for another training camp.EN Espoir : Les Verts en regroupement à Alger ==References== ==External links== * * DZFoot Profile * Category:Living people Category:1989 births Category:French people of Kabyle descent Category:Sportspeople from Saint-Étienne Category:Association football defenders Category:Kabyle people Category:Algerian footballers Category:Algeria under-23 international footballers Category:Algerian Ligue Professionnelle 1 players Category:Championnat National 2 players Category:Championnat National 3 players Category:AS Saint-Étienne players Category:FC Libourne players Category:USM Blida players Category:SA Thiers players Category:ASF Andrézieux players
title: Lounis Lanseur
